text: what’s the difference between calling `broadcast(f, x)` and `f.(x)`? I have the feeling it has to do with whether a certain broadcaststyle is applied, but I can’t find it in the docs.

No real difference, it seems
```julia> Meta.@lower f.(x)
:($(Expr(:thunk, CodeInfo(
    @ none within `top-level scope'
1 ─ %1 = Base.broadcasted(f, x)
│   %2 = Base.materialize(%1)
└──      return %2```
`@less broadcast(identity, [1,2])`  shows
```roadcast(f::Tf, As...) where {Tf} = materialize(broadcasted(f, As...))```
